Crime_Name: Administrative Error in Granting Leave to Appeal
Legal_Issue: Whether the Pension Appeals Board's decision to grant leave to appeal without following proper procedures and providing reasons is valid
Decision_Outcome: The decision to grant leave is quashed, and the matter is remanded for re-determination with a requirement to provide reasons
Legal_Rule: Under Rule 4 of the Pension Appeals Board Rules, an application for leave to appeal must include specific details; discretionary decisions require reasons
Procedural_Issue: Board granted leave without recording the decision or providing reasons, violating procedural rules
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to comply with Rule 4 and absence of recorded reasons
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Decision quashed, case sent back for re-determination with instructions to provide reasons
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Violation of procedural fairness due to lack of reasons and non-compliance with required procedures
Applicant_Challenge: Mr. Montesano did not submit required materials under Rule 4
Legal_Rule_Source: Rule 4 of the Pension Appeals Board Rules
Outcome: Decision quashed, remanded for re-determination with reasons
Remedy_Sought: Remand with instruction to provide reasons
Legal_Provision: Rule 4 of the Pension Appeals Board Rules
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of procedural compliance, absence of recorded reasons
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Re-determination of leave to appeal with reasons
Governing_Rule: Rule 4 of the Pension Appeals Board Rules
